https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. CO is a pollutant that can affect air quality and human health. These data can be used to monitor air quality and pollution levels.
https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Project: MOPITT - Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/HLS/HLSS30.00.Description: The Harmonized Landsat and Sentinel-2 Surface Reflectance Daily Global 30m (HLSS30) product provides consistent surface reflectance data from the Operational Land Imager (OLI) aboard the joint NASA/USGS Landsat 8 satellite and the MultiSpectral Instrument (MSI) aboard the Sentinel-2A and Sentinel-2B satellites. The combined measurement enables global observations of the land every 2-3 days at 30-meter spatial resolution. The HLSS30 product may be useful in disaster-related research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/HLS/HLSL30.00.Description: The Harmonized Landsat and Sentinel-2 30m BRDF-Adjusted Reflectance (HLSL30) product provides consistent surface reflectance (SR) and top-of-atmosphere (TOA) brightness data from a virtual constellation of satellite sensors. The Operational Land Imager (OLI) is housed aboard the joint NASA/USGS Landsat 8 and Landsat 9 satellites, while the Multi-Spectral Instrument (MSI) is mounted aboard the European Space Agency's Sentinel-2A and Sentinel-2B satellites. The combined measurement enables global observations of the land every 2-3 days at 30-meter spatial resolution. The HLS project uses a set of algorithms to obtain seamless products from OLI and MSI that include atmospheric correction, cloud and cloud-shadow masking, spatial co-registration and common gridding, illumination and view angle normalization, and spectral bandpass adjustment.

https://www.usgs.gov/landsat-missions/la.Description: The Landsat Collection 2 Surface Temperature dataset measures the Earth's surface temperature in Kelvin and is an important geophysical parameter in global energy balance studies and hydrologic modeling. These data are also useful for monitoring crop and vegetation health and extreme heat events, such as natural disasters (e.g. volcanic eruptions, wildfires) and urban heat island effects.

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements, which can be used to monitor air quality and pollution. These data can be useful for studying air quality and pollution in urban areas.
https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Project: MOPITT - Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. CO is a pollutant that can affect air quality and human health. These data can be used to monitor CO levels and study air quality and pollution.
https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Project: MOPITT - Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. CO is a pollutant that can have harmful effects on human health and is a precursor to the formation of ground-level ozone, a criteria air pollutant. These data can be used to monitor air quality and aid in forecasting air pollution events.

The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements, which can be used to monitor air quality and pollution. These data can be useful for studying air quality and pollution in urban areas.
https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Project: MOPITT - Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/ASTER/AST_08..Description: The ASTER L2 Surface Kinetic Temperature data product contains surface temperatures at 90 m spatial resolution for land areas. These data may be useful in studying urban heat islands and land surface temperature.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/ECOSTRESS/ECO.Description: The ECO2LSTE (ECOSTRESS Land Surface Temperature and Emissivity) dataset provides atmospherically corrected land surface temperature and emissivity (LSTE) values derived from five thermal infrared (TIR) bands. These data may be useful in urban heat island research.
https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/ECOSTRESS/ECO.Project: ECOSTRESS - ECOSTRESS Land Surface Temperature and Emissivity

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/ECOSTRESS/ECO.Description: The ECO2CLD V001 ECO2CLD_001 data set provides a cloud mask that can be used to determine cloud cover for the ECO1B_RA_D V001, ECO2LSTE_L2_V001, ECO3_ET_PT-JPL_V001, ECO4_ESI_PT-JPL_V001, and ECO4_WUE_PT-JPL_V001 data sets. The ECOSTRESS Level 2 cloud product is derived using the five calibrated thermal bands in a multispectral cloud-conservative thresholding approach. The details of the algorithm are provided in the Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document (ATBD). The corresponding ECO1B-GEO data product is required to georeference the ECO2CLD data product.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/QLW535AYJ498.Description: The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.
